component.text:
RELEVANT PORT STATUS LED INDICATORS
STAT
(port status) 		Off No link, or port was administratively shut down.
Green Link present.
Blinking green Activity. Port is sending or receiving data.
Alternating green-amber Link fault. Error frames can affect connectivity. Excessive collision, CRC, and alignment and jabber errors are monitored for a link-fault indication.
Amber Port is not forwarding. Port was disabled manually by an administrator, or automatically by an address violation or switch management functions.

Note: Upon switch startup or attachment of an end-user device, the port LED can remain amber for up to 60 seconds before it begins forwarding. Once forwarding status is reached the LED will turn green.
Blinking amber Port is blocked by STP and is not sending or receiving packets.
DUPLX
(duplex) 		Off Port is operating in half duplex.
Green Port is operating in full duplex.
SPEED 10/100 and 10/100/1000 ports
Off Port is operating at 10 Mbps.
Green Port is operating at 100 Mbps.
Flashing green Port is operating at 1000 Mbps.
SFP ports
Off Port is operating at 10 Mbps.
Green Port is operating at 100 Mbps.
Blinking green Port is operating at 1000 Mbps.
Note: The 1000BASE-T SFP modules can operate at 10, 100, or 1000 Mbps in full-duplex mode or at 10 or 100 Mbps in half-duplex mode.
